scientists.name: Isaac Newton
scientists.biggestAchievement: Developed the laws of motion and universal gravitation

scientists.name: Albert Einstein
scientists.biggestAchievement: Developed the theory of general relativity

scientists.name: Marie Curie
scientists.biggestAchievement: Pioneered research in radioactivity and discovered two new elements, polonium and radium

Isaac Newton.title: Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica
Isaac Newton.description: A mathematical treatise that lays out the principles of classical mechanics and is considered one of the most important works in the history of science.

Isaac Newton.title: Opticks
Isaac Newton.description: A book about the nature of light and color, where Newton explores the properties of light and how it interacts with matter.

Isaac Newton.title: Method of Fluxions
Isaac Newton.description: A mathematical treatise on calculus that contains the first published account of the calculus of infinitesimals.

Albert Einstein.title: Special Theory of Relativity
Albert Einstein.description: A scientific theory that describes the relationship between space and time, and the behavior of objects in motion.

Albert Einstein.title: General Theory of Relativity
Albert Einstein.description: A scientific theory that extends the special theory of relativity to include gravity and the curvature of spacetime.

Albert Einstein.title: Einstein's Miraculous Year
Albert Einstein.description: A book that discusses Einstein's contributions to physics during the year 1905, including his papers on special relativity and the photoelectric effect.

Marie Curie.title: Traité de Radioactivité
Marie Curie.description: A book that describes the discovery of radioactivity and the properties of radioactive materials.

Marie Curie.title: The Radium Institute
Marie Curie.description: A research institute that Curie established in Paris to study radioactivity and train researchers in the field.

Marie Curie.title: Discovery of Radium and Polonium
Marie Curie.description: A paper that describes Curie's discovery of the elements radium and polonium, and her work to isolate them from pitchblende ore.
